trans-unit.source: ’s design goals and motivation are to provide a library for running non-blocking asynchronous SSH commands in parallel with little to no load induced on the system by doing so with the intended usage being completely programmatic and non-interactive.

trans-unit.source: A configuration management and automation tool that makes use of SSH remote commands. Uses, in parts, both Paramiko and OpenSSH binaries.
trans-unit.target: Una herramienta de gestión de configuración y automatización que hace uso de los comandos remotos de SSH.Utiliza,en partes,ambos binarios Paramiko y OpenSSH.

trans-unit.source: Again similar to Fabric, its intended and documented use is interactive via command line rather than library API based. It may, however, be an option if Ansible is already being used for automation purposes with existing playbooks, the number of hosts is small, and when the use case is interactive via command line.
trans-unit.target: Nuevamente similar a Fabric,su uso previsto y documentado es interactivo a través de la línea de comandos en lugar de basarse en la biblioteca API.Sin embargo,puede ser una opción si Ansible ya se está utilizando con fines de automatización con los libros de juego existentes,si el número de hosts es pequeño y si el caso de uso es interactivo a través de la línea de comandos.

trans-unit.source: Conversely, many short lived commands with output gathering will not scale as well. In this use case, smaller pool sizes in the hundreds are likely to perform better with regards to CPU overhead in the event loop.
trans-unit.target: Por el contrario,muchos comandos de corta duración con recogida de salida no se escalan tan bien.En este caso de uso,es probable que los tamaños de grupo más pequeños en los cientos se desempeñen mejor con respecto a la sobrecarga de la CPU en el bucle de eventos.

trans-unit.source: Gathering is highlighted here as output generation does not affect scaling. Only when output is gathered either over multiple still running commands, or while more commands are being triggered, is overhead increased.
trans-unit.target: La recolección se destaca aquí ya que la generación de salida no afecta la escala.Sólo cuando la salida se reúne ya sea sobre múltiples comandos todavía en ejecución,o mientras más comandos se están disparando,se aumenta la sobrecarga.

trans-unit.source: Highest performance and least overhead of any Python SSH library
trans-unit.target: El mayor rendimiento y la menor sobrecarga de cualquier biblioteca Python SSH

trans-unit.source: However, it lacks support for some SSH features present elsewhere like ECDSA keys (PR pending), agent forwarding (PR also pending) and Kerberos authentication - see feature comparison.
trans-unit.target: However, it lacks support for some SSH features present elsewhere like ECDSA keys (PR pending), agent forwarding (PR also pending) and Kerberos authentication - see feature comparison.

trans-unit.source: In addition,
trans-unit.target: Además,

trans-unit.source: In general, long lived commands with little or no output gathering will scale better. Pool sizes in the multiple thousands have been used successfully with little CPU overhead in the single thread running them in these use cases.
trans-unit.target: In general, long lived commands with little or no output gathering will scale better. Pool sizes in the multiple thousands have been used successfully with little CPU overhead in the single thread running them in these use cases.

trans-unit.source: It does not support non-blocking mode, so to make it non-blocking monkey patching must be used which affects all other uses of the Python standard library. However, some functionality like Kerberos (GSS-API) authentication is not currently provided by other libraries.
trans-unit.target: No soporta el modo no bloqueante,así que para hacerlo no bloqueante se debe utilizar el parche de mono que afecta a todos los demás usos de la biblioteca estándar de Python.Sin embargo,algunas funcionalidades como la autenticación Kerberos (GSS-API)no son proporcionadas actualmente por otras bibliotecas.

trans-unit.target: Iteration ends only when remote command has completed, though it may be interrupted and resumed at any point.

trans-unit.source: Note that enabling recursion with SCP requires server SFTP support for creating remote directories.

trans-unit.source: On the other end of the spectrum, long lived remote commands that generate no output only need the event loop at the start, when they are establishing connections, and at the end, when they are finished and need to gather exit codes, which results in practically zero CPU overhead at any time other than start or end of command execution.
trans-unit.target: On the other end of the spectrum, long lived remote commands that generate no output only need the event loop at the start, when they are establishing connections, and at the end, when they are finished and need to gather exit codes, which results in practically zero CPU overhead at any time other than start or end of command execution.

trans-unit.target: Once either standard output is iterated on to completion, or

trans-unit.target: Una vez que toda la salida se ha reunido,los códigos de salida están disponibles incluso sin llamar.

trans-unit.source: Out of all the available Python SSH libraries,
trans-unit.target: De todas las bibliotecas disponibles de Python SSH,

trans-unit.source: Output generation is done remotely and has no effect on the event loop until output is gathered - output buffers are iterated on. Only at that point does the event loop need to be held.
trans-unit.target: Output generation is done remotely and has no effect on the event loop until output is gathered - output buffers are iterated on. Only at that point does the event loop need to be held.

trans-unit.source: Run SSH commands over many - hundreds/hundreds of thousands - number of servers asynchronously and with minimal system load on the client host.
trans-unit.target: Ejecutar comandos SSH sobre muchos-cientos/cientos de miles-de servidores asincrónicamente y con una mínima carga de sistema en el host del cliente.

trans-unit.source: SCP
trans-unit.target: SCP

trans-unit.source: SCP is supported - native clients only - and provides the best performance for file copying.
trans-unit.target: SCP está soportado-sólo para clientes nativos-y proporciona el mejor rendimiento para la copia de archivos.

trans-unit.source: SFTP
trans-unit.target: SFTP

trans-unit.source: SFTP is supported natively. Performance is much slower than SCP due to underlying library limitations and SCP should be preferred where possible. In the case of the deprecated paramiko clients, several bugs exist with SFTP performance and behaviour - avoid if at all possible.
trans-unit.target: El SFTP se apoya de forma nativa.El rendimiento es mucho más lento que el SCP debido a las limitaciones subyacentes de la biblioteca y se debe preferir el SCP cuando sea posible.En el caso de los clientes de paramiko desaprobados,existen varios errores con el rendimiento y el comportamiento del SFTP,que deben evitarse en la medida de lo posible.

trans-unit.source: To meet these goals, API driven solutions are preferred first and foremost. This frees up developers to drive the library via any method desired, be that environment variables, CI driven tasks, command line tools, existing OpenSSH or new configuration files, from within an application et al.

trans-unit.source: the event loop to allow others to execute - co-operation. When one co-routine is constantly grabbing the event loop in order to gather output, or when co-routines are constantly trying to start new short-lived commands, it causes contention with other co-routines that also want to use the event loop.
trans-unit.target: the event loop to allow others to execute - co-operation. When one co-routine is constantly grabbing the event loop in order to gather output, or when co-routines are constantly trying to start new short-lived commands, it causes contention with other co-routines that also want to use the event loop.
